title: Your First Lambda Function Written in Swift

abstract.text: A step-by-step tutorial to learn how to implement, build, test, and deploy your first Lambda function written in Swift.

is an important library for the Swift on Server ecosystem. The initial API was written before
async/await was introduced to Swift. When async/await was introduced, shims were added to bridge between the underlying
SwiftNIO
interfaces and async/await. However, just like
and
, we now want to
shift to solely using async/await instead of
interfaces. For this, large parts of the current API have to be
reconsidered.

that is passed in as an argument, meaning that the

title: Deploy your function to AWS Lambda

abstract.text: Learn how to compile your code to run it on Amazon Linux.
Learn how to create a Lambda function using the AWS Management Console and to deploy your zip file
Learn how to invoke the Lambda function using the AWS Lambda API and the AWS command line.
Learn how to create your project, add dependencies, and create and test your first Lambda function in Swift.
Create a new swift project and open Xcode.
Prepare
to define the project targets and dependencies.
Now that our project structure is ready, let’s write the code of your Lambda function. Perform the following steps in Xcode or another IDE of your choice.
Before to deploy your Lambda to AWS, you want to ensure that it works on your local machine.
